pros: I’ve worked as a clinical dietitian for 8 years, and DCI was my favorite setting by far. I felt very supported by the staff and loved having so many opportunities to form relationships with my patients. The workload is appropriate and I even had time to be creative!
cons: You will educate patients about the same things repeatedly, but this gives an opportunity to be creative.

pros: Long orientation, helpful staff, repetitive work thats very routine, varied shifts, sundays and major holidays off
cons: Nurses are expected to do janitorial work while assigned to care for patients. Breaking boxes/taking out waste- no housekeeper on site during patient hours. The environment is hot and humid and masks are still required. They cap pay below what other jobs are making in the area. Hours that are expected are very long 14.5 hours- they don’t include your lunch in the time expected to be in the building.

job_title: Licensed Practical Nurse (LPN) in Warrensburg, MO
pros: Great wages and insurance, haven’t had too many issues with leadership, only 4 days a week
cons: Weekends/ rotating schedules, it is long shifts

pros: I actually loved working for DCI It was the 3rd dialysis company I had worked for in my career. By far the best one.
cons: Long hours. I really can’t complain. My clinic closed.

job_title: Licensed Clinical Social Worker in Omaha, NE
pros: Autonomy and schedule flexibility for professionals
cons: Somewhat behind in salary trends except for specific fields

job_title: PCT Patient Care Tech in New Iberia, LA

job_title: Certified Hemodialysis Technician in Chattanooga, TN

job_title: Acute Dialysis RN in Omaha, NE
pros: Work independently with support from coworkers, techs and management.
cons: Weekend call, overnight on-call, but we are there to respond to health emergencies for hospital inpatients. It comes with the job!

pros: Very flexible with scheduling needs.
cons: No cons noted at this time.

job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Birmingham, AL

pros: The pay and benefits are good. Gained a lot of experience while working here
cons: Environment feels corrupt at times. Managers don't seem to care much for workers.

job_title: Registered Nurse in Glens Falls, NY
pros: Work every other Saturday, Sundays off. Do not have to work thanksgiving, Christmas or new years.
cons: Pay based off experience as RN and not dialysis experience - which dialysis is a specialty and as an RN there was not much change to my job title aside from administering medications and performing assessments

review_title: Good Non-Profit company to work for
job_title: Acute Dialysis RN in Pittsburgh, PA

cons: Long hours if you are on call.

pros: The hours and not open on Sundays
cons: Management never has your back. Different rules for different people. It’s a very toxic environment.

job_title: Patient Care Technician in Kansas City, MO

job_title: PCT Patient Care Tech in Fort Benning, GA

pros: Wonderful to work for and great atmosphere

pros: Team work, Management, a overall great place to work.

review_title: Worst experience in my 15 years of nursing
job_title: Registered Nurse in Kansas City, MO
pros: The hours and work schedule were nice. That’s it
cons: So many! They run a fear based culture with many immature staff and administrators. They care more about their own necks and not much about their patients. It is an unsafe job for any nurse or dialysis patient. Beware

review_title: Terrible place to work for with toxic, racist, sexist environment.
pros: Maybe decent benefits if you’re a healthy individual.
cons: Unorganized, money driven without a care for patient or employe well being. Toxic, racist, sexist work environment. Low payment to work ratio. Often work without any bathroom or lunch break. Training is awful. Promotions are meaningless and only guarantee about $1 pay increase so it leads to a dead end job opportunities. If you want a leadership role they rather hire from outside the company than to reward loyalty. The hard workers get punished more often than the people who do the bare minimum or even at all. In fact, the people who do the bare minimum get rewarded and promoted faster. They tend to hire people with no experience or work ethic for the job that is required causing more work for those who actually care. Their mission is meaningless they harass nurses and families to acquire donors so that they can maximize their profits with little to no compensation to them, and unfair wages to technicians. Demand is driven by greed and not actual need causing employees to work harder, longer and mandatory overtime. Suggestions to make work life environment fall on deafs ears. Too many negatives to discuss in a simple review site where attrition rates have increased in an alarming rate. There’s history of sexual harassment and racism with leadership with little repercussions and honestly they should be investigate. They will get rid of victims over abusers as long as things are kept quite.

pros: Good Team to work with
cons: Small pay but makes you work more. Not appreciative of their staff

pros: Great people, laid back, flexible, and care about employees and patients.
cons: The pay is on the lower end for dietitians and other staff.

review_title: Great Company but pay is on the low side
pros:
Great ethics
Great people
Founder is hands on
cons: The pay is on the lower end of the average. You certainly could not survive on the salary with the high costs of housing.

pros: non-profit mentality, nice people, admirable mission, good work/life balance
cons: struggling from some bad decisions, struggling from covid, bad employees weighing down good employees

pros: Tue-Fri 10hr shifts with day shift hours only, rotating Saturday, great co-workers and a generous annual bonus, health benefits and PTO/ESB plan.. Its a small, specialized reference lab that has a family feel and lacks the stress of a hospital.
cons: There has been a negative culture shift in the last few years which has effected staffing and morale. Pay and retirement match are below what other area labs offer. Very out dated processes and technology that creates a very laborious manual accessioning process that is redundant and slows work flow. Not much opportunity for promotion or career advancement. Upper lab management seems disinterested in employee concerns and fails to communicate with staff, which creats confusion and a strong disconnect. Short staffed with a push by management to do more with less staffing.

job_title: CCHT/Patient Care Technician in Atlanta, GA
pros: The patients you get to care for
cons: Management from the clinic to cooperate to the doctors are all terrible.

Leaving that place was like breaking up with an abuser finally! Thank god I did!

The inventory, work order and clock-in system (software) is very outdated and slow. Too much work including non biomed related job like buying coffee/breakroom supplies for the clinic then pay was not enough.

job_title: Nephrology Social Worker in Meraux, LA
pros: I have worked at DCI for 14 years. I also have twins and my supervisors are flexible with taking time off when they are sick or have doctors' appointments.
cons: The health insurance will no longer cover spouses if they are eligible for benefits through their employers. I have worked at DCI for 14 years. My salary has been capped for the past 3 years. When I have asked about having the cap raised I am told by administration that they plan to revisit the cap in the near future. My hours were also cut from 40 to 34 hours per week.

pros: DCI has excellent insurance benefits and the cost is very low compared to other companies. They are very liberal with PTO and have an excellent training program. The company's motto is, 'The patient is the reason for our existence' and the patients are treated very well. Many patients have commented that they are treated better at DCI and that the focus is more on the patient then trying to penny pinch.
cons: There isn't a lot of room for growth and there are limited opportunities for advancement. They do not pay as much as for profit dialysis clinics. Otherwise it is a great place to work for. This also depends on your individual manager but for the most part it is an excellent place to work.

pros: Great non-for-profit organization, patient care and research are a priority, work schedules are reasonable, long term staff members, reasonable insurance and benefits. Company has been in business for many years. Provide educational assistance.
cons: Low pay scale, not much teamwork, poor communication from Administration down. Promotion opportunities are limited. Company does not keep up with changes in field or health care very well. Unless you are an RN your opportunities are limited.

review_title: A trial in patience and forgiveness
pros: Help the patients. Staff is close. You will get overtime but they will complain about it.  Ummm.....staff is close.
cons: Management above Nurse Manager does not care about you. They will look you in the eye and lie without blinking. Understaffed with no help coming. Will work you like a rented mule and not pay you much for it. Upper and mid management get their vacations but won't hire anyone so we can get ours.

review_title: Negligent and Misleading Management /. Tucson, AZ
job_title: Corporate Billing Specialist, Tucson AZ in Tucson, AZ
pros: Benefits are fairly good. They allow business casual dress. You are able to make your own hours and your work area is is of ample size.
cons: Administration promises they take care of their Billing staff. You literally  interview for hours, which basically turns into nothing more then an interrogation. Once hired, management avoids you. An Administrator makes negative innuendos toward staff, which make them feel belittled and unimportant.  When you offer input, you are asked if this may not be the right job for you. You are basically threatened with your job when you show concern and interest in trying to improve any process. Management is not open to you informing them of billing issues or trends. Administrator constantly asks about the same inquiries with each monthly A/R Meeting but fails to do anything. When you ask about why management is failing to want to address Billing and A/R issues, they put a spin on it, trying to make it look like their really busy, or  will try to make it look like the staff is lazy. It's a constant battle, and you realize early on that the administration is not what you thought he was. They make themselves look good with corporate, while at the same time, making the downfalls look like it is caused by staff. It is always the office management who would not back up staff or address issues brought to their attention. Poor quality Administration. This was the sole cause of the billing department to shut down.

job_title: Registered Nurse in Kansas City, MO
pros: Typically secure position if you do your work.  Open to new ideas.  Annual meetings for management in Florida.  Good benefits, lower pay scale vs other dialysis clinics in the area.  Micro management if you like that style.  Communication with HQ is improving.
cons: In Kansas City, upper management are burnt out and there is a high amount of office politics.  High turnover and low regard for the floor staff with minimal education involvement.   On the local level  there is poor communication and favoritism is prevalent.

review_title: Great Small Company Filled With Compassion, But not  A lot of room for Professional Growth
pros: Small company so although the workload is still great it's bearable and not as overwhelming as you would find in large hospitals. Because of this it is easier for Dialysis Technician's and Nurses to maintain close supportive relationships with patients without ever feeling burnout.
cons: Because this is a non-profit company the salary range is small and set. There is not a lot of room at all for professional advancement and non at all for earning raises and bonuses.

job_title: Corporate Billing Specialist in Nashville, TN
pros:
Decent wage and benefits for a job that has relatively low education and skill requirements.
They prefer to promote from within when possible and provide education reimbursement if skills apply to work.
cons:
Sick leave earned is not allowed to be used at employees discretion. 
The work is quite boring and never ending.

pros: The environment here is very relaxed and there is not a lot of pressure to meet deadlines or work at a certain pace. Perfect place to work for people who want to keep a great work life balance. Healthcare benefits are AMAZING.
cons: Not a place to go to get paid top dollar. Work from home policy is sort of annoying at times in that you can't do it without extreme circumstance or with early request.

review_title: I think DCI far exceeds any dialysis company when it comes to ensuring the care of the patient comes first.
job_title: RN Charge Nurse in Atlanta, GA
pros: It is the most diverse patient population. DCI welcomes and nurtures patients new to dialysis. They genuinely have the patients care a priority. Of course, financial services have to be addressed. But first, we are going to get you a good treatment.
cons: The on)y problem I encountered was some of the dialysis technicians felt their certification was equivalent to a 4 year nursing degree.

pros: The benefits are great and the cost to the employee is low. Its a fast-pace enviornment.
cons: Working with different personalities. At any point there are more than 10 employees on shift and we all have to count/depend on eachother. Stay positive and only assume best intentions in others.

review_title: Be Prepared to Work Harder Than You've Ever Worked
pros: steady pay, 3 weeks paid vacation after the 1st 2 yrs, good health insurance, free pharmacy for generic meds, uniform allowance, year end bonus based on years of service.
cons: grossly understaffed, patients being allowed to do pretty much whatever they pleased.

pros: The best razon I want  to work in this company is   I  know have  good benefits very professional staff. And will Have more good experience  with patients and coworkers and also good environment
cons: Looking for better position and good benefits. And I will work close my home and I will not spend a lot gas and  I will feel much better

review_title: Excellent team to work with, good benefits, good schedule, horrible pay.
job_title: Patient Care Technician in Jefferson City, MO
pros: It's nice to work with a team that legitimately cares about the patients.
cons: Helping to keep people alive with the best quality of life possible should pay far more than what I get paid.

pros: I was a part of the 2011 DCI summer internship program for undergrads. It's really hard to find clinical internships that pays so this was a great opportunity. The program was very well organized but you still have the freedom to explore what you're interested it.
cons: Nothing much. You have to look for your own housing options but it's paid for once you find something.

pros: Awesome, family run, non-profit organization whose reason for existence in the care of the patient and not the profit.
cons: Local administration unapproachable, defensive and insecure.

review_title: Management can run a good staff in the ground

review_title: It is a fair company, pretty good benefits when compared with others.

review_title: Its a great place to work.

pros: After working at several dialysis companies, I realized that the education received at DCI was the best. Made me the dialysis nurse I am today. Also, the benefits have been the best by far.
cons: During my time at DCI, they were still using paper charting. More up to date record keeping would have made things better.
